abstract: With the market churning unpredictably these days, the Federal Reserve may show a paper loss of as much as $6 billion on its portfolio of Bear Stearns assets, according to a Bank of America analyst note cited by Bloomberg News.
lead_paragraph: With the market churning unpredictably these days, the Federal Reserve may show a paper loss of as much as $6 billion on its portfolio of Bear Stearns assets, according to a Bank of America analyst note cited by Bloomberg News.

headline.main: Fed May Show Unrealized $6 Billion Loss on Bear Assets, Report Says

abstract: Merrill Lynch’s chairman and chief executive, John A. Thain, will remain at Bank of America after the merger of the two financial giants, Charlotte-based Bank of America said in a statement Thursday.
snippet: Merrill Lynch’s chairman and chief executive, John A. Thain, will remain at Bank of America after the merger of the two financial giants, Charlotte-based Bank of America said in a statement Thursday.
lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch‘s chairman and chief executive, John A. Thain, will remain at Bank of America after the merger of the two financial giants, Charlotte-based Bank of America said in a statement Thursday.

headline.main: Thain to Take Role at Bank of America

abstract: Merrill Lynch’s chief, John A. Thain, will essentially retain control of the businesses run by Merrill in the combined company.
snippet: Merrill Lynch’s chief, John A. Thain, will essentially retain control of the businesses run by Merrill in the combined company.
lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch’s chairman and chief executive, John A. Thain, will remain at Bank of America after the merger of the two financial giants, Bank of America said Thursday.

headline.main: Thain to Take a Role at Bank of America
headline.print_headline: Thain to Take a Role at Bank of America

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
